Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery amphora (possibly a belly amphora); interior reserved; exterior: glazed at top, edged in red; below; incised lotus and palmette chain with single row of linking circles; red on alternate fronds of palmettes, on kalyx of lotuses and middle petal of middle petal of some lotuses.
Curator's comments: For similar lotus palmette chains, compare the one-piece amphora, Rhodes 14093 (Böhr 1982, no. 77) and the neck amphora Louvre F227 (Böhr 1982, op. cit., no. 107); both are attributed to the Swing Painter. Böhr, E., Der Schaukelmaler. Mainz 1982.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 211, no. B34)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0006) (Phase 1)
